title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: They will ask direct questions about why you want to join the program, and what motivates you. How will you impact and what will you bring to the table for the team?
Interview Questions: They will ask direct questions about why you want to join the program, and what motivates you. How will you impact and what will you bring to the table for the team?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (Queens, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process at York was very thorough. I received an opportunity to understand their mission and vision for their students as well as an opportunity to connect my work experience to the role. At the end I was given the opportunity to create my own syllabus and learning objectives.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a professor?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: It was fine; faculty seemed a bit burned out but the values seemed in the right place. I did notice there were only two people of color out of six people present and the white people spoke most.
Interview Questions: What my priorities would be for the center

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: 2 hour group interview that was fairly standard. We each answered ice breaker questions and then broke off into groups to create a project we then presented to the interviewers.
Interview Questions: Why we felt the cultural arts were an importance facet of the city?

title: Building Re-Tuning Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Simple. The Director and Co supervisor will thoroughly analyze your resume and ask you a set of questions based on your resume that will allow you to go depth in your experiences. They will ask you
Interview Questions: They ask for interest in the industry, Do some research on company, Why you want to work there.

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Very simple and straightforward, mostly conducted over email. Referred by a friend who taught at a CUNY school, and once I sent my CV and cover letter, the process went quickly.
Interview Questions: What is your previous teaching experience?

title: IT ASSISTANT Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: They had three separate interviews Twice in person to meet the head of the department, and once to get a feel of how things worked in the office. I really don't have much more to say other then be honest and be willing to learn new tricks on your own. These jobs do not teach you, you need to be a self learner.
Interview Questions: Asked me my knowledge on basic networking skills

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Fly you to New york city. Interview with professors there at some of the different institutions. I recommend you contact professors you'd want to work with prior, and this will give you a leg up. Also, make sure you say you are interested in multiple colleges colleges at CUNY (not just the manhattan ones).
Interview Questions: One question that stumped me. What is a recent paper/clinical trial that you are excited about.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very long process, but great to meet multiple players in CUNY. The process in total took about a month. You submit your application online, then meet with a board, then with your supervisor, and then a decision is made.
Interview Questions: They asked about your background experience.

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I applied to be a tutor here in 2019. It went really well because it was easy going. They care less about interviewing skills and more about whether you would be a good tutor or not.
Interview Questions: Please solve this math problem and tell us any difficulties you know students may have. Describe how you would get the student through this difficulty.

title: Adjunct Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Very Quick,  all was explained in terms of what the job entailed and I had plenty of time to ask questions. I had worked at the school prior to this last interview; so the interview went very smoothly.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Registrar Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: In person interview for part-time registrar assistant. It was mostly basic questions. My major, hobbies, past experiences working as an assistant etc. Interviewed by two people. I met with my interviewers at Hunter college campus (registrar area). Interview was short about 15 minutes. I got a follow up email later that week with the offer.
Interview Questions: What is your major? Past work experience?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Regular questions, not too much techbical but depending on what your position is please prepare yourself.... they might ask questions about that . But they won't ask technical questions just behavioral questions
Interview Questions: -tell me why you want this job?

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very very smooth. It was all done in about 2 different stages. I first had a meeting with two marketing managers in the Department for the role. The next stage was meeting the Executive Director who was the hiring manager or decision maker.
Interview Questions: If you were a good team player

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview was easy.  I went through 2 short interviews with the hiring manager and HR people.  The hiring manager asked about my background and related work experience for the job. The entire interview took two weeks. Everything went well and I received the offer two weeks from the time I was interviewed.
Interview Questions: what has been your best work achievement to this point in your career?

title: EHS Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very bureaucratic administration at CUNY made for a very slow interview process even by being hired internally. There were two rounds of interviews, one with HR and one with hiring manager. There was a four month gap between those two interviews. Confirmed that I was the top candidate one week after interview with hiring manager. Took six weeks for them to make an offer.  Pay was lo but benefits package is excellent.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions and more technical questions to test proficiency in my job function.

title: Administrative Superintendent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: There were two rounds of interviews over the course of a few months. Each had three panelists. First interview was not until 4 months after application and with staff from other departments. Second interview was with leadership from the department applied to.
Interview Questions: Any experience working with difficult employees and how I handled it.

title: Senior Director Budget and Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen and panel interview.  The next steps would have bene a performance exercise and final interview with the Dean. They ultimately decided not to fill the role at this time.
Interview Questions: Very personable staff who made me feel comfortable

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Fairly standard logistics and it involved a group interview.  I withdrew after the group interview because one of the interviews was sarcastic and openly hostile during the interview.  He later apologized - as did the hiring manager - but there was no way I could take this as a sign of a good place to work.
Interview Questions: "I hear a lot of talk - where's the proof? Why should we hire you?"

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Adapted to my timeline. Very well organized schedule. It went smoothly and easily. It felt comfortable and safe. This is a great environment. I highly recommend it. Thank you very much
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Admissions Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Multiple rounds with a search committee. Asked questions about resume, experience, and others. Quick follow ups as well, very good institution with good missions. Also asked about leadership skills, etc.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you had to deal with someone difficult.

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Got called and had a conversation about previous teaching experience and comfort with the subject matter. Also got asked about the theory that I would cover and teach in the course.
Interview Questions: What theory would you include in this course?

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: One interview. important questions. Did not feel uncomfortable and was able to ask my own questions. Was not told if i had the job in the interview. Was called by HR.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about you
Hobbies
Experience with role
under pressure and resiliency questions

title: Paralegal Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: It was a very laid back interview and low stress. Met with the director and the interview was approximately an hour long. It was not a difficult interview. No need to stress.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Plumbers Helper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Simple. They are straight to the point. Ask you about tools used in the trade (basin wrench, open end wrench, etc).  Ask about situations that were challenging and your solutions.
Interview Questions: What is a Plumber’s Helper (Tool)?

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: My title as a college assisstant meant I worked hourly and even though I was able to get certain benefits, due to the amount of hours I worked; I was hourly and had to be re appointment yearly.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in IT?

title: Custodian Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward. Good experience. Showed care for the employees. Demonstrated expectations and asked questions to help me understand better the job. Interviewer was very friendly throughout process. If you are looking to work. Try you hardest to get an interview here.
Interview Questions: Are you capable of these expectations?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: It was thorough and selective. They asked a lot about how I am planning on helping and what is my approach in tutoring. They had me taking a test right in front of them about math and CS I guess to see what I can bring on the table.
Interview Questions: Tell us a time where you were in difficulties and what you did to overcome them.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Meet at a career fair. Interview was over the phone went over resume and past job history and skills. Followed by a second interview which was in person where we went into future details about the job and by resume
Interview Questions: To go over resume and past experiences

title: IT Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone call. It was a briefing of a few questions related to IT. But I never got to speak to the head of IT/manager. Just a brief phone call about myself.
Interview Questions: What do you expect from this job?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: The usual academic process of meeting with the search committee, minus (in my case) contact with students and postdocs. Not impressed at all, but I think it was an issue with the Chairperson at the time more than a general problem.
Interview Questions: What was my research about/was I prepared to teach

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: asked about prior experience and had several rounds of interviews with different members of the team.  did take a while for them to get back to me. and i had to wait for additional rounds between interviews for them to get back to me which took weeks.
Interview Questions: tell us about yourself.  what previous experience do you have. what is your degree and background.

title: Resource Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: after the initial application, there was a questionnaire to answer followed by an interview. the process was quite simple overall probably because the city is in distress with so many covid19 cases.
Interview Questions: when was a time that you had to step up as a leader?

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Simple and straight forward. They were patient and ask you questions about yourself, your work ethic, prior experience. They then ask you to do a mock tutor for a sample math question.
Interview Questions: Q: Describe a time you were able to overcome an obstacle?

title: Adjunct Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Easy! Normal question of interview in academia. Accepted the offer and this was my first job position in my profession here in the U.S after moved from Europe.Working at CUNY was a great experience, i learned new things for the education system here and this experience helped me for the other position  after.
Interview Questions:
1.Did You have thought courses of Geology in English?
2.Do you have a american reference?
3.Can we contact your reference? etc.

title: CUNY Tutor Corps Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: During the interview processing, we first go through easy behavioral interview questions. Afterward, the interviews ask you to pick one of the eight given questions, and you are asked to solve the problem and explain it on your own word.
Interview Questions: What do you want to teach?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Great, ask questions that are in-depth about yourself. Gave a great attitude in what they were looking for in a Professor. Normal Interview nothing out of the ordinary.  It was a ​calm environment​, with only one person taking notes.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself​?

title: Financial Aid Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Started with a screening interview over the phone, followed by an in-person interview.
During the panel interview, I was asked questions about my qualifications, background, work history, and relevant skills.
Interview Questions:
1) Tell me something about yourself
2) How did you keep yourself up to date
3) What your coworkers would say about you
4) What financial aid programs are you familiar with

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (Brooklyn, NY) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied almost 3 months before I got the email about the interview and my availability . Called for an initial interview, then a follow up interview. Over a period of 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: Very basic questions, that they read from a script. Situational mainly.

title: Database Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Very simple, involved a meeting with two people who discussed experience and gave an overview of the role. Discussed many aspects of Database design and their current situation. Good opportunity to demonstrate understanding and expertise.
Interview Questions: What are some projects you have worked on?

title: Physics Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about background experience as a tutor. Other requirements include time limits at which you must be there which could be difficult to meet if you're a full time student.
Interview Questions: Previous grades for classes you intend to tutor

title: Professional Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, then had a phone screen. I then went in for an in-person interview and had to do a writing test onsite. I was then sent a seven-page application to fill out, with my entire employment history, references, etc. After spending all that time and energy, I never heard from them again, despite following up.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience in a start-up like environment?

title: Full Time Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: In depth analysis of my skills and potential was required plus a review of my recent theoretical writings and a review of my performance recordings. The interview panel was vigorous in any assessment of present skills and in projecting my future potential.
Interview Questions: Why did I think I would be successful

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Simple process, confirmation of education and experience, questions regarding education and experience, asked what classes/ hours/ days were preferable. Quick, able to email documents, had to complete some long paperwork and submit it
Interview Questions: What is my teaching experience

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I got a phone call to schedule an interview two days after submitting my resume. It was a zoom interview. They asked some basic questions and asked about my availability for work.
Interview Questions: introduce myself, software skill,s and  my availability

title: Collections Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. Basically CUNY sends email to students who are interested. After applying, I received an email regarding interview. It was pretty straight forward. You ca reschedule if you want.
Interview Questions: On the interview, I was asked to choose 2 Questions from a set of questions. I had to solve them and explain them how I got the answers. Those are some pretty easy coding questions like CS 101 (as I applied for cs tutor role). After that they will just ask some hr interview questions about how you will behave in a given situation.

title: Tutor/College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy, they told me to write down what a snippet of code will outputs. You just need to trace the code and write down the output. There will be some behavioural question about how you will behave in a given situation.
Interview Questions: they told me to write down what a snippet of code will outputs. You just need to trace the code and write down the output. There will be some behavioural question about how you will behave in a given situation.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Looked up for the position on website. Process took about 2 weeks. Supervisor contacted through email. asked me about the previous work history and safety procedures regarding working in lab. Easy interview.
Interview Questions: Previous work history.What days are you Available? Knowledge of laboratory Safety procedures. Basic sample preparation. General laboratory maintenance.

title: Adjunct Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: I was a former grad. students and was asked to teach. No interview. Internal candidate. I do not know what is is like to apply outside. But I heard it is best to know people in the department.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: It's based on your teaching experience and your degree. Also some teachers work as a part-time faculty. An appropriate teaching schedule need to be decided without conflicts. It's also helpful for you to get the position with referral from some other faculty.
Interview Questions: How long have you been teaching?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: It was one of my professor, looking for a grad student to help him code on opnet for some simulation.And he talked about how he will publish papers with my name on it.
Interview Questions: No question asked

title: Adjunct Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (Bayside, NY) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Was pretty straight forward. I sent an email to the department heads and was invited for an interview. I was asked to give a 10 mins presentation demo. The committee appeared to be very friendly during the interview. Hopefully i got the job!
Interview Questions: Experience, lecture demo, hours of availability

title: Reporter/Producer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: It was a standard interview process. I  met with Executive Director and there was a roundtable of show producers who were asking me questions. I was hired within a week and have been very happy since then.
Interview Questions: What was the most challenging story you have covered, why, and how did you overcome the issues?

title: HEOa Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is long. You have to do three interviews. They encompass  phone call, committee interview ( this can be 2-4 people)  and the direct supervisor interview.   It also takes a long time for the company to call you for interview and to offer you the position. I will say it may take 1-2 months to know if you are in the running.
Interview Questions:
What is your leadership style?
Describe you have made a social impact in students lives?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Interview was simple, just asked a few questions about technology and see if you can answer the following
When you get accepted the interview questions were plain and simple and you leave after you finish the following questions
Interview Questions:
What is a router
What the difference between a modem and router

title: Cuny Start Cooperating Math Teacher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: The online application required you to submit a mock lesson plan for the CUNY Math Start program. After the initial screening, they will set up a phone interview with you to get to know you and see if youre a right fit for the position.
Interview Questions: What about the program compels you to want to teach here?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: The first stage was a brief twenty minute phone interview with a hiring committee with a few basic common interview questions.  The second phase was an in-person interview with the committee.
Interview Questions: What has been your experience with technology

title: Adjunct Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back.  You are asked about the classes that you have taught in the past and your availability.  You are then offered an hourly wage amount and asked to sign a contract.  After the contract signing they get you into the school data base and you have to fill out paperwork. Great overall experience.
Interview Questions: What dates and times are you available?  When can you start? What tools do you need?

title: CUNY Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Apply. Take the test and pass. The College of your choice will either call you in to their campus to interview or you'll attend  a pool. Basic interview questions were asked.
Interview Questions: Why would you be a good fit at our College?

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: There are three interviews. The first is an initial phone call, second is an in-person with two HR employees and a third and final in-person with the Head of HR.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: The initial application is online. If approved, you are placed in a pool of applicants and called for two rounds of testing. You interview with schools in various boroughs depending on your initial preference as indicated in your application.
Interview Questions: I was asked about the most positive work experience I have had and why.

title: Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview and and in person interview with the director. I found that the employer was very communicative and reached out to me to tell me about the steps of the process. While I did not ultimately get the job, I kept in communication with the director regarding an event that was happening that I was interested in.
Interview Questions: What motivates you in the workplace?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Committee interview has a list of questions and then hiring managers will interview you. the process is very long and takes more than 3 months. they will call your employer for references.
Interview Questions: How do you justify existence of regulation ?

title: Assistant Higher Education Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: It was very lengthy. There are anywhere from 2-4 rounds of interviews and it is not uncommon for you to receive an invite to interview months after your application is submitting as hiring committees need to be charged.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Event Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: This was for the CUNY Law School. Average interview, but took a long time for the whole process, about 6 weeks total from the phone interview, 9 weeks from my initial application.  First, a short phone screen with HR and some team members, less than 10 minutes with basic simple questions (tell us about yourself and why you are interested in the position).  Then, a few weeks later, in-person interview, about 45 minutes with the whole Events team. This was also average, but they had a lot of questions. There were 4 others in the room with me and they had a list of questions and went around asking all of them, but they were all basic questions. Strengths weaknesses, tell us about a difficult time, what is the biggest event you coordinated, etc... Then, a few weeks later, in-person with the Dean and the Events Manager. This was shorter, but the questions were a bit more challenging and some off topic, not really events related, but more a to get to know me, this was about 20 minutes.  After that, they gave me a tour, a really long, detailed, wonderful tour (the facility is amazing!) A few weeks days later, called my references. A few weeks later, offer! The people were wonderful and answered all of my questions. They invested in the interview process!
Interview Questions: Largest event you coordinated?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: After a few days I got a call back to answer some questions about what I have done and what stack I know. Then was further tested on terminology for various parts of the development process like security and databases.
Interview Questions: I was asked to explain normalization for SQL databases and how it can help, when it is useful. And in addition I was also asked when and why you would denormalize a SQL database.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Easy. Just asking random questions like how's new york time subscription? 
What's happening with the latest news? So on and so forth Easy. Just asking random questions like how's new york time subscription? 
What's happening with the latest news? So on and so forth
Interview Questions: I am not quite sure what this is

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Such a fun and easy process I'm glad i went through a very swift process in CUNY. They are very transparent and straight to the point.  Very cut and dry about what they expect of you and willing to work with you to any capacity.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself 10 years from now?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: there are two interviews. Interviewers are nice, the questions are pretty straight forward. they asked a few questions in a row. it is okay to ask them to repeat their questions.
Interview Questions: why do you apply for this position ?

title: Business Data and Reporting Analyst, Level I (Provisional) - Business Office/Payroll Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I was called for an interview. I applied for the job 3+ months before being called. During this phone call, any questions I asked were not answered. For example, I asked the salary. I was asked to refer to the job description. I was provided the wrong job title, so it was difficult for me to find the position. When I asked for the job description, I was told that if she sents it to me, she has to send it to everyone.  The interview was scheduled (time) and I made accomadations to make it possible to attend the interview yet, no inteview details were given to me. This includes the location of the interview, who I'm interviewing with, etc. 
The interview process can be a difficult one and this person who called me had no consideration for the candidate.
Interview Questions: We are only interviewing on Friday morning and Monday, are you available to make it?

title: Post Doctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: The phone interview was short, and specific five questions. The interviewer was not friendly, but right on point to asking questions. One thing I was surprised was that the interviewer wanted interviewee to call, not the other way around. It would'd been better if the interviewer mentioned that in the email. The interview was smooth, and I thanked for the opportunity
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience on... (one of the job description)

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a typical academic interview. It was a typical academic interview and the process mirrored what you will encounter at other schools when you are interviewing for a teaching job. Panel interview, etc
Interview Questions: They asked about teaching style, commitment to diversity, and teaching interests.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: There were 3 interviews, by phone, in person, and then the last one due to conflicts also on phone. The agency was not very flexible in understanding I had a full-time job and it was hard for me to go in person for the second interview with only 1 day to shift and prepare. However, I noticed this small window and high expectation of flexibility on the part of the job applicant was standard.
Interview Questions: Give an elevator pitch to the chancellor describing the merits of the job you are applying for.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Very Standard, wanted to know about my background, they ask very common questions. they sit a panel. There was 5 people who had an opinion on who to hire. each department heads.
Interview Questions: How much experience do you have in teaching

title: DOE IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Filled the form of interest in the position. Then I got a link to create an account and submit my resume to CUNY simplicity website. I got an email to schedule an interview. The interview was efficient, no introduce yourself type of questions, simply IT related questions.
Interview Questions: how will you fix a computer that never stops loading during startup?

title: Campus Security Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: It's a two to four person panel just be yourself and answer the questions politely. Nothing to hard and don't be nervous. Overall it's was a minor step towards getting hired.
Interview Questions: How would you get to work? Would you do overtime? Would you work holidays and weekends?

title: HR Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Extensive and long. Four separate interviews. offer came six months after first application. It takes this long. other positions it can take shorter or longer, but on average it will take 3 plus months for an offer to come.
Interview Questions: How does your experience relate to the job?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied and took the civil service exam. It took almost a year to receive  my score and then an additional year to get an interview. I was selected for a hiring pool and had an interview with NYCCT Recruiter. I was selected immediately.  The paperwork was really fast and I started working two weeks later.
Interview Questions: what is one of your weakness

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: This is due to the financial aid process therefore the interview entailed selecting time-slots when I was free and also a mini- practice session on what the work entailed.
Interview Questions: When are you able to work?

title: Athletic Conference Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was thorough and structured. The coordinator kept us at the office for about 30 minutes and the questions that he had asked were very inciteful. You felt immediately comfortable once you walked into the building.
Interview Questions: Who is your number 1 role model?

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick and straightforward. There were 2 interviewers who asked questions about my work experience and activities outside of work (hobbies, travel, etc.). There was a lack of communication as to whether I was accepted for the position at first. Wasn't aware until I was asked a week later if I had gone for my fingerprints.
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths and weaknesses?

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (Brooklyn, NY) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Easy, quick and straight forward, very fair and made an offer fairly quickly training was easy and quick to learn as well. First it started with an email, then an in person interview after an offer was made through email. it all took about a week.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Work Study Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (Bronx, NY) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interviews were very relaxed and since I was coming in as a work study it really was not a matter of my qualifications but more about my availability and what my class schedule was like.
Interview Questions: What was my schedule like

title: IT Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (Brooklyn, NY) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions:
need to know basic knowledge of networking and  computer 
5- 15 in person  interview
After accepted
finger printing
background check
information session 
takes about month  to complete application process
then have to attend 1 training while you are ding an intern
Interview Questions: How do you Explain what router is to a person with no technical knowledge

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (Brooklyn, NY) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: This position is civil servant.  Took the exam in Dec 2015.  Was emailed by HR in July 2016, letting me know of vacancies at a specific cuny school and to send my resume.  Resume was sent, had interview in early August.  Was interviewed by HR and the department chairperson (she was not present so it was a conference call).  HR asked basic interview questions, Chairperson just spoke about the details of the position and asked if my prior experience would be a good fit for such tasks.  I was told they would get back to me in 2 weeks.  When I got home I received an email with a Job Offer.
Interview Questions: Why CUNY?

title: Adjunct CLT Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (Bronx, NY) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very simple. All I did was fill out the paperwork, basically. I was practically handed the job; other than me being qualified I assume because they really needed to find someone ASAP. The woman from HR was very kind.
Interview Questions: Do you have any questions?

title: Budget Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online on cuny website, but I had the phone call from cuny central office after 1 month

you can choose the phone interview date. 

1st, phone interview (10~15min)

simple question and background check with nice and sweet HR recruiter 

2nd, interview in cuny central office
Interview Questions:
1st, self-introduction
2nd, my strength, and weakness

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process seemed to go well. In both the first and second interview, I was asked similar generic questions. They gave me a situation and would like to see how I'd handle the situation. It was very regimented, particularly the second interview the the directors. 

I put a lot of weight on myself over it. I unfortunately was not accepted, I was pretty much told in a vast pool of qualified applicants, I was not able to make the cut. I then thanked them in an email and asked what exactly I was lacking for future job applications, as I am very interested in admissions, but never received a reply. I'm disappointed particularly because this was a part-time entry level position and I have both my BA and MA from CUNY. Somewhat shows how they value their own degrees if they're not even willing to accept their alumni.
Interview Questions: Tell us a particular situation where you felt challenged but overcame it.

title: Adjunct Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (Staten Island, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, then in person interview.  It was an easy enough process that took around a month from start to finish.  Nothing out of the ordinary.  The one annoying part was paying for faculty parking!
Interview Questions: How I would engage students with the material and how I would teach it to them?

title: Tutor (College Assistant) - Center for Math and Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (Bayside, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: go to the math center, the professor over there will ask you some math questions. the course you are taking, what grade.  after check everything, they will ask the time.
Interview Questions: how do you teach the students?

title: Study Abroad Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a normal face to face interview with director and assistant director. normal questions like "tell me about yourself" as well as STAR format questions so be prepared for that.
Interview Questions: tell me about a time when you were faced with conflict at work and how you dealt with it?

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (Brooklyn, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Sat down with the two Directors and they asked me the general interview questions (ie. how do you meet the qualifications for this job?). I was hired within a week.
Interview Questions: How does your prior work experience make you a good fit for this job?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was very short, like 15mins tops. I guess it was an initial screening exercise to sieve through all applicants. I suppose that this was necessary to narrow down to only suitable candidates for further follow-up.
Interview Questions: Very basic questions. Nothing too complicated.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was brief and to the point. Ask you basic personality/introductory questions. Always have your resume handy. The supervisor and a career counselor take the interview. It is not difficult if you are prepared. Know everything on your resume.
Interview Questions:
1. tell me about yourself.
2. Why do you want to work at GCMC?
3. How did you handle difficult situations.

title: Lab Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (Brooklyn, NY) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
the interview was easy. I have been interviewed by the chair and three other faculties member
I am a former student of new york city college of technology, so I knew most of the professors
They asked me to interpret a chromatogram and explain a basic meltic point lab process
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked in a lab?

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: There are 3 people in the room. They asked me to describe my background. Tell them why I like to apply this position. Why I think I am qualify for this position? Do you have referral?
Interview Questions: Can you explain this to a student?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I initially had a conversation with the department administrator over the phone. I was later brought in to visit the department and meet with the head. The interview process was brief. It included a department head and a another current faculty member. I had to provide a previous syllabus and speak to the texts I chose for the course. I had a longer 1:1 conversation with the department head at the end of the process.
Interview Questions: They asked how I would account for different learning styles and cultural norms around learning in the classroom.

title: Senior Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Two-stage interview—first with a panel, second with the head of the division that offers the position. The panel was great and questions were mission- and job-related. The one-on-one with division head was strange, involving several irrelevant questions and hinting at some unorthodox internal politics.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a situation in which your immediate supervisor is directing you to pursue an objective and the division head, who is not your direct supervisor, is asking to be "kept informed" about your supervisor's actions?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was unorganized.  they decided when the interview started that they didn't like the questions HR provided them so they asked me to leave the room to come up with more questions.  40 mins later i was asked back
Interview Questions: why do you want to work for cuny

title: Student Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and straight forward. HR representative will call you and ask you to come in to fill out an application.You then come in and then fill out the application after you get called in to interview with a manager
Interview Questions: typical clerical questions.The manager asked basic clerical questions. He also asked about previous work experience.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (Staten Island, NY)
Interview Descriptions: You have to take an exam and then meet with the supervisor for further questions. He/she will review your application answers and ask you questions based on the answers provided. He will then probably start you off with a few hours a week then bump you up more hours. Once offered the job, you will have fill out an employment packet and get three references.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with us?

title: CUNY Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Civil Service Examination first step. Did not hear back for a year. Finally, received an email that I was selected for hiring pool. Went to through the hiring pool with several other candidates. You are called one by one to interview with different colleges that are offering positions. If the dept representative  and human resources representative agrees to hire you on spot. If not you are not offered a position and must move on to the next college.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: At a job fair, there was no discussion of work expected to be done, the interviewer simply wanted to ask me what my major was, what I planned to do after college and when I could work.
Interview Questions: What is your availability?

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (Staten Island, NY)
Interview Descriptions: In person interview with wonderful people. I was called in for a brief interview with the hiring manager and then a second interview with the person I would report directly to. The process was painless.
Interview Questions: Standard questions about experience and know-how.

title: Cuny Start Cooperating Math Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submit the application, was called to interview in person. The director and a math lead teacher interviewed me together. Then I was given a sample math test to take but it really didn't mean anything.
Interview Questions:
What would I see in your classroom if I walk by?
What do you believe is the best way to learn mathematics?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: With the professor who is responsible for the tutoring Lab at the college in the Math and Computer Science department. I got an email from the college saying they were looking for Junior or Senior level students who would like to work as tutors and help other students with their academic work.
Interview Questions: To simply show my ability in Math and Computers

title: IT Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: I took the city exam, scored 100 points. About 100 us who scores 100 were called to interview for about 4 colleges. Each college was hire about 2 people. we were called based on the first letter of our last. I was interviewed by 3 people. One Hr special and 2 senior IT special.
Interview Questions: General interview questions. Then  i was called back for some basis it questions

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: went over the lists on the resume. asked the questions all related to what  I have written on the resume. asked preference work schedule since this is a part-time job.
Interview Questions: How good are you in using Excel

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Long process. Took months for the whole process to finish ( from day of application to offering of the job). But at the end, it was all worthy. They often say, it all happens in CUNY time.  True that!
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Doorman Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: assist  guest'  immediatey  unload transport custamer   form the car hotel am   hard working  .....productuctive   open minded  am  honest  get   with supervisor   the interviews can help you greatly  can i depend on you' area good worker  you do  have experience  and training  to do the  job ...if  we  hire\   you   are you like to stay on job  for  reasonable period' of time and be   productive....... why should'  i hire you'   what  don;t you tell me  a bout yourself  what your  es major  weakness  how  does your previous' experience relate to  the jobs  we have here
Interview Questions: have  work doorman before' yes; have hand on experiences'

title: MBA Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was overall very comfortable atmosphere, if you prepared you'll do fine. They did ask why I was looking to apply at Baruch and not NYU. I was a bit thrown off guard by this. The entire interview lasted for about an hour.
Interview Questions: Which concentration are you interested in?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: I was hired after a brief group interview in 2009. They were in need of professors, but after the initial interview, I was able to teach every semester. Things have tightened since then.
Interview Questions: "How do you deal with disruptive students?"

title: Payroll Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was short, not at all as what I had expected. Met with many people, some seemed familiar with the process, however, they didn't seem to know how to do the work itself.
Interview Questions: It seemed the people interviewing were in experienced. I seem to know more about payroll then they did. I wonder if they train these people, as anyone can press a button to do payroll.

title: Project Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I applied and two days later received an invitation to participate to attend an in-person interview. 

At the time of the interview, I was told that final candidates would be invited back for second round interviews. However, after my first interview, the hiring manager called and offered me the jobs and explained that she was confident that I was the right person for the position and would not continue the search.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about your project management experience.

Explain your experience in higher education.

Do you feel that you are able to meet the requirements of this position?

title: Graduate Teaching Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied for PhD. Interview over Skype with four professors. Typical questions you would expect from such an interview. Everyone was nice but the four people at once added some difficulty to the Skype interview.
Interview Questions: What research do you intend to do?

title: College Assistant/Helpdesk Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: The process included two interviews of two supervisors, and then with an HR manager and an IT manager.  Questions asked included: technical skills, personalities, availability, and experience.  While technical skills questions were asked, the interviewers were more focused on personality and compatibility.
Interview Questions: What would your process be in dealing with a difficult user ?

title: Higher Education Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: CUNY looks for prior CUNY Experience first. Masters is the minimum requirement regardless of what is stated in job application. There is always a committee with staff and faculty members.
Interview Questions: Questions are pretty basic.  Tell us about yourself and how it relates to the position, what would you do in this student scenario, what would you do in this staff scenario, why cuny, what are your future goals, why you, etc.

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Got an call from an HR coord. was told to come in and this time and date and meeting with 2 staffs from HR. Interview was about an hour long, waiting time was long.
Interview Questions: very standard and easy.

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I just filled out a work-study form when i applied to cuny. They ask you when at some point in your application just click the box that says “YES.” There were no real hoops to jump through, but keep in mind that just because you sign up doesn’t mean you’ll get the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Volunteer Tax Preparer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions:
read the material from Baruch VITA, took an online exam, if passed, will be qualified for the weekend study program. 
have to attend weekend tax preparer program. Two weekends, saturdays and sundays. Then took a comprehensive exams. if passed, can be a tax preparer.
Interview Questions: the comprehensive exam is very difficult, and it requires more than you needed for an ordinary tax situation.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (Brooklyn, NY) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had a very informal meeting with a senior manager and department head. VERY professional. The Senior Manager was also new to the position, but he gave me a lot of information beforehand on how to be succesful in the interview. I recommend always knowing someone before applying for a position at CUNY.
Interview Questions: What qualifies you for the role?

title: Adjunct Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Was taken to cover the course quickly due to a  shortage of teaching staff.  I had many years teaching prior to that and it helped. Came  through a recommendation of a friend who worked for JJ at the time.
Interview Questions: Previous teaching experiences

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Two months later participated in phone interview. Within a week was invited to campus, which happened within the month. However, it took over 5 months for travel expenses to be reimbursed.
Interview Questions: I don't recall any difficult questions. They were very typical questions about teaching style, dealing with difficult students, research priorities, potential external funding sources, etc.

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Was fair, careful, but more basic given it was over 30 years ago. Focus was on teaching skill, philosophy, but fortunately the then chair emphasized reserach commitment and need to publish for tenure and promotion.
Interview Questions: How to deal with difficult students.

title: Adjunct Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions:
Interviews with different professors, make a class presentation about Chemistry, then went to a series of questions with the hiring committee. 
Questions about academic background and also about how to manage different academic situations with students.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Building Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fair and asked general questions about a building's heating, ventilation and air conditioning systems. For a person that has spent any time in a boiler room or as a technician should not have a problem. A license to operate high pressure boilers and a refrigeration engineer license is required for the job.
Interview Questions: Do you know how a VAV system works?

title: Academic Peer Instructor/Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, about 20-30 minutes long. It was conducted by the main program coordinator as well as the assistant coordinator. The whole process was laid back and personal. There were about 10 or twelve questions asked, most of which were directly relevant to my teaching experience and my confidence in the subject I have chosen to teach.
Interview Questions: Why you would like to work with us?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was very straight forward. I send in my application and had a interview. I knew people who worked there before so they told me who to apply to.  I interviewed with one person
Interview Questions: How many shares are trading at the exchange right now? pulled out a yahoo screen

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Went to the a office in the school and asked if they needed someone. I was asked if I had experience, I replied no, and within a week started working.
Interview Questions: Asked if I had office experience.

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Guilty of 'bait and switch' - advertised full time professor position, offered adjunct position instead. Only 15% of instructors are full time professor, the rest are adjunct
Interview Questions: Would you be interested in an adjunct position if you were not selected for the advertised position -

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: I was invited by a professor in CUNY and got accepted.
Interview Questions: To test out the subjects that I never learned before

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions:
In order to be hired you need to take a test in the subject in which you intend to tutor. The test is at the level of what you would expect from a midterm in a class in that subject. There are no trick questions, they just want to make sure that you know the material.
There is also a short interview with the head of the math center.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went well. The interview consisted of three team members. They had their own questions. It was a smooth dialogue.
Interview Questions: Questions consist of a description about yourself, summarization of employment history and how will I be a good fit for their institution.

title: CUNY Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
Was interviewed by two beautiful women.
One was truly a champion in looking out for me and my colleagues.  Helped and protected us when we needed it most.  Miss and truly admire her always.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty laid back. However, it took a while to get in touch with the human resources department. They are actually pretty slow when it comes to getting things done. Once, reached, though, I was able to have an easy interview that did not have any curveball questions. Everything was pretty standard.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation when you had to solve a problem?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. It took a little long for them to return, but I was interviewed by the director of the program and someone from the central office. Later, it took a little long again to hear from them back.
Interview Questions: How do you implement reading in class?

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (Brooklyn, NY) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: One in-person interview that lasted about 30 minutes. Questions on my experience with college students and my ability to tutor different classes offered at that specific university. Brief role playing with the interviewer as a tutor-student session. Overall, not an overly difficult interview, and I believe some applicants that accepted the job had no prior tutoring experience.
Interview Questions: What's a difference between how teachers approach students vs a tutor?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: 1 short phone interview and 1 in-person interview (one-on-one). Basic questions regarding content I would be tutoring and the role of a tutor for a student. I was offered a job shortly after my in-person interview.
Interview Questions: Regarding a basic principle of a subject I claimed I could tutor

title: Adjunct Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: This is dependent on one's relationship with a department's chair, but most importantly the (often last minute) need for a class to be taught.
Interview Questions: Confidence is key.

title: Fixed Assets Analyst (Finance Coordinator) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by three persons from HR, accounting and tax supervisors in Nov-2013. Interview took about 30mins and they were very cordial. What came up is that the accounting department and the posts job was not organized well as they admitted when asked (lots of backed up work, reporting channels, etc). Fairly easy interview but no offer received but a regret 7 months later.
Interview Questions: Normal questions asked including working in teams, reporting and prior experience in the (tax) area.

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed a few days in advance to prepare a lecture (20 minutes) for majors and non-majors.  On the interview date I presented the lecture and afterwards sat down with the entire department for an "informal" question and answer period.
Interview Questions: The questions were basic: What is your teaching style? How do you think you will fit in with the student body? What do you hope to bring to the department, etc.

title: Help Desk Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: very straight forward and to the point, typical help desk question, knowledge of A+, imaging software's, processors, situational questions.Tech and customer services questions. Any knowledge on network tcp/ip. cabling and punch down of wires
Interview Questions:
Previous jobs
Help desk experience

title: Assistant to HEO Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: received a phone call, an interview was set up, then again another one to meet the department director.
Interview Questions: lots of questions were ask non-stop from the directors, she kept going on and on and did not smile at all. Was very intense.

title: Adjunct Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Basically, I was hired by the Deputy Chair on the spot.   I had submitted all required paperwork.  It was a last-minute hire and I was saving their skin.
Interview Questions: Are you available to work at such-and-such a time at such-and-such a place?

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews the process was straight forward. The first interview the interviewer explains to you about the paper work and your pay,schedule things of that nature. The second interview  more about the duties you will be performing on the job.
Interview Questions: Do you think you will able to handle the front desk reception area.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Group interview; nothing unusual; helps to know someone, many personalities
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Adjunct Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview for this position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Substitute Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (Brooklyn, NY) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: well explained before interview
Interview Questions: How do you handle Diversity?

title: Financial Aid Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward, and basic behavioral interview questions. Internal hiring tends to happen quite often.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York)
Interview Descriptions: Worked as an intern beforehand and they simply asked my if I wanted the position.
Interview Questions: Would you like the job?

title: COA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: The process is lengthy and in most cases you will not receive any feedback or a "thank you for applying" email. In most instances they only interview for legal purposes because 9 out of 10, they already have a candidate in mind.
Interview Questions: How do you handle irate students?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The phone interview was on the phone. Tasks and duties expected for the position were clearly stated and described from the very beginning. Conditions of the position were clearly disclosed. The interview was one and a half hour long.
Interview Questions: What is your experience is some specific tools?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Hired with minimal interview process based on previous work study experience in department, which rendered me suitable for the position since I had already become familiar with the skills needed, department culture, and had the right availability. The position ended up being low impact in terms of skills and ingenuity. I basically provided coverage for the office and did some administrative work and data entry.
Interview Questions: I should have asked more questions about technical skills I might acquire in this position.  In retrospect I would have liked career development and job training opportunities.

title: Adjunct Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: If you are already in the cuny system, introductions are simple, however you must interview with the chair and the coordinator. Once an appointment is setup, you sit together and discuss previous teaching experience, your teaching style, and questions aimed at understanding how you would handle classroom experiences. In some schools, at the end of the interview, you receive a posting. In others, the interview concludes and the administration reaches out within one or two weeks.
Interview Questions: Do you have previous teaching experience?

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) in Oct 2012
