Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a current employer. It was a simple but lengthy process. I had an interview with two supervisors. They asked easy questions wanted a description of your experience. Once interviewed I had got notice within my e-mail that I received the position, and was waiting approval of the human resource department. I interviewed in October 2012, and started working in January 2013.
Interview Questions: How many times were you absent or late from your previous job?

title: Adjunct Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (Staten Island, NY) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Wonderful interview. It was very comprehensive and I received a lot of information about the job, job conditions, and it helped me tremendously in deciding to take the position. I was interviewed by the person I'd be reporting to, not HR, which was very advantageous.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you had a student who was consistently disruptive in class?

title: Adjunct Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Department Chair was very friendly and welcoming.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: The director asked me all the questions, needed someone to do the paper work. so do you have enough time besides your school. just like that i had the job.
Interview Questions: Have you work on filings? Microsoft word, clerical job questions

title: Software Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: a full test include algorithm, database, c language, and front end question, simple, but almost everything will be included
Interview Questions: which tools you are using?

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (Brooklyn, NY) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was granted an interview via phone about a month after I submitted my application. After a successful phone interview, I was given an in-person interview and was offered the position a month after.
Interview Questions: No questions were too difficult or unexpected, everything that was asked pertained to either the position or an relevant experience.

title: Chief Diversity Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: One telephone interview, one search committee interview and one face-to-face interview with top management. Each member of the search committee asked a different question. At first, I received a letter stating that I was not selected but that was a mistake. I got the job letter offer soon after. There was no moving help and I moved myself to New York City.
Interview Questions: normal interview questions about past work experience

title: College Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: One interview with the head of the department.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for the City University of New York

title: CUNY Office Assistant Lvl II Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: You must first take a CUNY office assistant exam for level one. After passing the exam, you will be given an opportunity to attend a job pool with reps from different CUNY colleges. Each college will interview you. After 3 years as a COA, you will be lvl 2.
Interview Questions: The questions will vary depending on the college. You will be given the opportunity to choose which borough of colleges you prefer. Just be sure to be knowledgeable of the different colleges for that borough.

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions:
The initial phone interview lasted about 45 minutes, however I was not aware that it would be an interview, i though they were just calling for a 2-3 minute thing. after the phone interview i was asked for a 1-1, emailed a whole list of things to complete and email and told the interview would last btw 20min and 1:20min. After meeting the initial person, i was told that i will be meeting with the director, but they made me waitt 40 min at which point i left (after nearly 2 hrs). 
make sure u ask before u go what the position entailes and the duration of the assignment.
Interview Questions: What is your main goal? And after you complete that one, what next? A?nd after that what next? (3 times same Q)

title: Adjunct Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at CUNY (City University of New York) (New York, NY) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: No interview. Email back and forth and sent CV.
Interview Questions: N/A
